channel.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
channel.description:
Hello,
I'm having a problem with Ubuntu Linux. I downloaded the .iso file for the bootable version from Ubuntu.com. I opened the .iso file and put all the files into the CD I burned using Ashampoo. I placed the disk in the DVD drive and then I rebooted my machine.
The bootable disk was supposed to boot up Linux from the CD, but instead, the computer loaded Windows XP.
I really want Ubuntu Linux on my computer. I'm so fucking fed up with Windows XP that it makes me want to hurl. Could someone please help me? Am I doing something wrong? Should I be using a different burning program?
Please help. Thank you very much if you can.
~Ron :(

item.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Have Windows and Linux.

Just partition your disk drive and have Windows on the C drive and have Linux on the D drive. You can switch between the two when you reboot your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

I wish I could use LINux instead of window$ but my dad -.-

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Yeah it was set to boot from cd.

I burned the .iso file on my CD with ashampoo and it still didn't work. Nero is the program that I needed. I used Nero and used Burn Image, then opened the .iso file in Nero, and put it on a CD. Then threw it into the disk drive and it worked wonderfully.

I already downloaded the install .iso file now. So now I will be using Linux instead of the dipshit Windows.

Thank you so much for your help everyone though.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

meh, go into your bios and set it to boot from cd first. this should be your standard anyway

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

Ron, When I first boots up PRess f12. Boot from cd/dvd/crd it should work ! cheers

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

you dont open the iso and burn all the files from it to the cd, because the iso has a hidden part that is the boot sector, you need to actually burn the iso on the cd, you can use nero for this, or my favorite program, alcohol 120%, hopefully that cleared things up for you

oh and moved

Read full topic
